comments.body:
Is `twisted` considered an optional requirement? I see it imported in:

https://github.com/etingof/pysnmp/blob/master/pysnmp/carrier/twisted/dgram/base.py#L8

and other locations.

They have listed it in devel requirements: https://github.com/etingof/pysnmp/blob/master/devel-requirements.txt
twisted is pulls in a lot of dependencies. 
What's CF's policy on optional dependencies?

I'm not sure if there is an official policy. I maintain the `apscheduler` feedstock that has optional twisted, asyncio, etc backends. I don't list them as requirements, but that library handles missing optional requirements gracefully:

https://github.com/agronholm/apscheduler/blob/master/apscheduler/schedulers/twisted.py#L8-L11

giving the user an informative message. I'm not familiar with this library, but I think it's fine to leave out `twisted` if it's optional (i.e you can run the package without it, but it's only used in a particular mode that the user is explicitly choosing to use twisted).
I am leaving it out from the 'run' section for now. Maybe someday conda will officially support optional dependencies, then we can add it.

looks like it could possibly be `noarch: python`:

http://conda-forge.readthedocs.io/en/latest/meta.html#building-noarch-packages
